resources.string: Atlantis needs to become Device Admin in order to perform its isolation tasks.

Atlantis is an application to help you run other applications in an isolated profile. It does so by making use of the Work Profile feature of Android.

Click "Next", and we will provide you with more information about Atlantis, and guide you through the setup process.

We suggest that you read through all of the following pages carefully.

By default, Atlantis will not ask for any individual permissions. However, once you proceed with the setup process, Atlantis will try to set up a Work Profile and hence become the profile manager of said profile.

This will grant Atlantis an extensive list of permissions inside the profile, comparable to that of a Device Admin, albeit confined to the profile. Being the profile manager is necessary for most of Atlantis's functionality.

Some advanced features of Atlantis may require more permissions outside the Work Profile. When needed, Atlantis will ask for those permissions separately when you enable the corresponding features.

Atlantis is developed and tested on AOSP-like Android derivatives. This includes AOSP (Android Open Source Project), Google Android (on Pixels), and most AOSP-based open-source custom ROMs such as LineageOS. If your phone is running one of the Android derivatives listed above, then congratulations! Atlantis is probably going to work correctly on your device.

Some device vendors introduce very invasive customizations into the Android code base, resulting in conflicts, incompatibility and unexpected behavior. Some custom ROMs can also introduce compatibility-breaking changes, but generally these are rarer occurrences compared to phone vendor-introduced incompatibilities.

Atlantis is merely an interface into the Work Profile feature provided by the system. If the feature provided by the system is broken or non-standard, Atlantis could not magically resolve the issue on its own. If you are currently using a vendor-modified Android version that is known to break Work Profiles, you have been warned. You may proceed anyway, but there is no guarantee that Atlantis would behave correctly under these circumstances.

We are now ready to set up Atlantis for you. If your device is running Android 7 or lower, please first ensure that your device is not in Do Not Disturb mode, because you will need to click on a notification later to finalize the setup process.\n\nWhen you are ready, click on \"Next\" to begin the setup process.
We are trying to initialize Work Profile and set up Atlantis on your device.

We regret to inform you that we were not able to set up Atlantis for you.

If your device already had a Work Profile, either from a previous installation of Atlantis or from another application, you will have to remove that profile in Settings -> Account before Atlantis can proceed.

Otherwise, if you did not cancel the setup manually, then the reason for the failure is most commonly due to a heavily modified system, or a conflict between Atlantis and other Work Profile managers. Unfortunately, there is not much that we could do about this.

Click "Next" to exit.

You should now be seeing a notification from Atlantis. Please click on that notification to finish the setup process.

If you do not see the notification, make sure your device is not in Do Not Disturb mode and try pulling down the notification center.

To reset Atlantis and start over, you can clear the data of Atlantis in Settings.
Click here to finish setting up Atlantis
Congratulations! You are one click away from finishing setting up Atlantis.
Atlantis will auto-freeze apps launched from \"Unfreeze & Launch\" on the next screen lock event.
Application installation finished in work profile.

Manipulating apps that are hidden from the list could cause crashes and all sorts of unexpected behavior. However, this feature can be useful when faulty vendor-customized ROMs does not enable all necessary system apps in work profile by default. If you continue, you are on your own.

When enabled, you\'ll be able to browse / view / pick / copy files in Atlantis from main profile and vice-versa, ONLY through Documents UI (named Files or Documents on your launcher) or apps with Documents UI support (they only gain temporary access to files you choose in Documents UI), while still pertaining the filesystem isolation.

Present a fake camera app to other apps, allowing you to choose an arbitrary image from Documents UI (and File Shuttle if enabled) as the taken picture. This enables File Shuttle for any app that supports invoking other camera apps to take a picture, even if they don\'t support Documents UI natively.
Deny access from main profile to contacts inside work profile.
When the screen is locked, automatically freeze apps launched from \"Unfreeze & Launch Shortcut\".

Do NOT freeze foreground apps (with visible activity) when you lock your screen. This can be useful for apps like music players, but you\'ll need to manually freeze them through \"Batch Freeze Shortcut\" afterwards.
Atlantis setup complete. Now restarting Atlantis. If Atlantis didn\'t start automatically, you may launch it again from your launcher.
Permission is denied or Unsupported device
Work profile not found. Please restart the app to re-provision the profile.
Cannot provision work profile. You may try again by restarting Atlantis.
It looks like you have disabled Work Mode while starting Atlantis. If you have enabled it now, please start Atlantis again.
Cannot clone system apps to a profile that Atlantis has no control of.
Cannot uninstall system apps in a profile that Atlantis has no control of.
Cannot add shortcuts to your launcher. Please contact the developer for more information.
All apps in \"Auto Freeze\" list have been frozen successfully.

Atlantis needs Usage Stats permission to do this. Please enable the permission for BOTH OF THE TWO Atlantis apps shown in the dialog after you press \"Ok\". Failing to do so will cause this feature to not work properly.
Cannot launch app %s because it has no GUI.
Atlantis needs access to All Files for File Shuttle. Please enable the permission for BOTH OF THE TWO (Personal / Work) Atlantis apps shown in the dialog after you press \"Ok\".

Atlantis needs to Draw over Other Apps in order for File Shuttle to function correctly. Please enable the permission for BOTH OF THE TWO (Personal / Work) Atlantis apps shown in the dialog after you press \"Ok\". This permission is used to start File Shuttle services in the background.
Cloning non-system apps to another profile is currently not possible on MIUI. Please clone your system\'s app store (e.g. Play Store) into the other profile and then install apps from there.
